Articles.Content:
As mentioned in the news, Russia has launched a mission to Phobos at 9 November 2011 - the Phobos-Grunt(Phobos-Soil in russian). Its engine has failed on the 200km Earth orbit. 13.5 tons of toxic oxidizer are going to drop on Earth(and no one knows where exactly are they going to fall).

The purpose of the challenge is to deliver as many fuel as possible to Kerbin\'s 80km orbit. Ships with no option to return are ACCEPTED, so you are not obliged to have any engines in the last stage.
could\'ve submitted my entry here, but my laptop went all apesh*t halfway of the mission.
Does it have to re-enter the atmosphere via aerobraking?
No. I mentioned that ships with no option to re-enter or escape are accepted.

No. I mentioned that ships with no option to re-enter or escape are accepted.

Cool, trying this later.
Easy to beat though, but just a head-start.
So, how many fuel have you delivered?

5 KW 1x2m and an orbital LFE.

wait... does the numerical value of each be taken to account? ???
